of the Julius Maximilian University Würzburg is offering a
Scientist/Postdoc Position
(m/f/d) in Biochemistry and Molecular Cell Biology

in the laboratory of Prof. Dr. Christian Haering. We investigate the mechanisms of molecular machines that organize the three-dimensional organization of eukaryotic genomes by combining molecular cell biology
column3: and structural biology approaches with cellular imaging and single-molecule biophysics techniques. See Shaltiel et al.

• Lead an exciting research project based on single-molecule imaging
• Communicate your research in presentations and publications
• Train students of various disciplines in biochemistry and molecular biology
What We Offer:
• A collaborative
column2: inclusive working environment with a diverse group of scientists

column1: • Access to a cutting-edge research infrastructure

column3: and/or genome editing in mammalian cells is a plus but not a requisite

column1: The position can be filled in full- or part-time (provided that job sharing ensures that the duties can be performed on a full-time basis) from July 1st
column2: 2023. Appointments are initially limited to three years
column3: with the possibility of an extension. Salary will be based on the pay scale for the public sector in Germany (TV-L).

column1: The JMU Würzburg aims to increase the percentage of women in research and teaching and therefore expressly requests applications from qualified female scientists. Preference will be given to handicapped persons in case of otherwise equal aptitude.
Your application should include a motivation letter
column4: and the names and contact information for at least two academic referees. Please send your application as a single pdf file by e-mail to bcz@uni-wuerzburg.de by latest May 5th
